intro: Paepalanthus savannarum var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-flowered arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
